alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Garza; Lynn (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 31 at 3:39PM CDT until August 31 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHERN CROSBY, GARZA AND NORTHEASTERN LYNN COUNTIES... At 339 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain starting to subside. However radar shows 2 to 3 inches just southeast of Post along US 84 and between Post and Tahoka on SH 380. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Post, White River Lake, Kalgary, Caprock, Southland, Grassland and Wilson. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
